feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 5 stages: D, R, I, V, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The transcript shows a functioning workflow that accepts transaction inputs, processes costs/profit, and writes results to Google Sheets—demonstrating the tool performs financial tasks. Implementation evidence (loops and end-to-end flow) plus the stated goal and reflection support that the student built a working, if simple, financial application.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission shows a working AI integration (an agent that parses inputs, uses memory, and logs to Google Sheets), so it adds value beyond a superficial demo. However the explanation and coverage are high-level and rudimentary with limited demonstration depth or multiple examples, meeting the standards for PARTIAL rather than a full PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "All I needed to do was build a very basic AI powered finance."
"I created a loop and I created three loops actually."
"He receives messages... and then it's gonna send it to her Google Sheets."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: Student states the problem and goal ("basic AI powered finance"), showing intent to build a financial app.
- Implement: Describes concrete implementation steps ("I created a loop and I created three loops") and a working workflow (message → processing → Google Sheets).
- Reflect: Student notes difficulty and learning, indicating iterative development and validation of the tool.
criteria.reasoning: The transcript shows a functioning workflow that accepts transaction inputs, processes costs/profit, and writes results to Google Sheets—demonstrating the tool performs financial tasks. Implementation evidence (loops and end-to-end flow) plus the stated goal and reflection support that the student built a working, if simple, financial application.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I built an AI, an AI, he receives messages. When he receives messages, he uses ch- right between all the brain and then he, this is the memory, this is the total memory. He uses this to do it and then they get sent to this right here." (1:12–1:25)
"I created a loop and I created three loops actually." (0:57–1:04)
"This thing will actually be useful on my day-to-day base." (4:43–4:54)
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: student identified the task as building a basic AI-powered personal finance tool ("All I needed to do was build a very basic AI powered finance").
- Implement: student describes concrete implementation steps (loops, an agent that receives messages and sends data to Google Sheets).
- Reflect: student acknowledges difficulty and limited scope, indicating partial learning and room for improvement.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a working AI integration (an agent that parses inputs, uses memory, and logs to Google Sheets), so it adds value beyond a superficial demo. However the explanation and coverage are high-level and rudimentary with limited demonstration depth or multiple examples, meeting the standards for PARTIAL rather than a full PASS.
